feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 28 at 3:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: A strong low pressure system will bring snow and blowing snow to the Portage Valley, southern portions of Turnagain arm and Turnagain Pass. Snow is expected to begin tonight around 9 to 10 pm and continue through sunrise tomorrow morning and then end shortly after sunrise. Expect 2 to 6 inches of snowfall across this area. Additionally, winds will increase out of the east and southeast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 28 at 3:06PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: A strong low pressure system will push a frontal system towards Kodiak Island this evening this will bring strong easterly winds and snow changing to rain. This is expected to be the first accumulating snowfall for the Kodiak City area. Light to moderate snow will begin later this evening before 9 pm and continue through midnight or shortly thereafter with brief periods of heavy

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 3:05PM AKDT until October 28 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of up to 2 inches above 1500 ft on the Klondike Highway. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 1500 feet including White Pass. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 3:05PM AKDT until October 30 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SATURDAY TO 1 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Haines Highway including Klukwan and Pleasant Camp. * WHEN...From 10 AM Saturday to 1 AM AKDT Sunday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 28 at 12:10PM AKDT until October 28 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one half mile. * WHERE...Pribilof Islands.

entry.title: High Wind Warning issued October 28 at 3:42AM AKDT until October 29 at 1:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...West winds 50 to 70 mph with gusts up to 90 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Aleutians. * WHEN...From 2 PM Friday to 1 AM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 28 at 2:39PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...EARLY SEASON WINTER STORM WILL BRING GUSTY WINDS, SNOWFALL, AND MUCH COLDER TEMPERATURES NEXT WEEK... * STRONG AND GUSTY WINDS: Winds will increase on Tuesday out ahead of an approaching cold front. Gusts of 35-45 mph are likely in the valleys with gusts possibly exceeding 55 mph in wind prone locations. Sierra ridgetop gusts could reach 80-100
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:34AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor generally continues on a slow decline, remaining within Moderate Flood Stage. Levels at Astor will continue a very slow recession through the upcoming weekend, although northerly winds may temporarily prevent a further decline

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:32AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Deland has risen slightly back to Major Flood stage. This brief rise today will be followed by a declining trend tonight and into the weekend. Flood conditions will steadily

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:24AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through early next week while continuing a slow decline. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 9:22AM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The St. Johns River above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood Stage. The river is forecast to continue a slow decline, dropping from Major to Moderate Flood Stage on Saturday. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts, although
